column4: I'm trying to install ubuntu on my computer and it really doesn't like my graphics card/mobo for some reason, any ideas?
Can you specify the card type?
well, I can install it, but the boot screen is extremely glitchy as it loads the live CD
radeon x800XL
nVidia Nforce4
AMD
At least, it should work with the VESA driver.
I tried the AMD specific 6.10 installer and vesa was default for some reason
I had to change it to radeon to get it to work at all
with what I do have installed it refuses to access the internet through either of my wireless cards (used seperately)
and the boot agent has a hard time actually getting ubuntu to boot
if it boots at all
Please one problem in one time.
heh, sorry
I installed the non-AMD specific 6.10, and now it runs, but it is very glitchy while it is booting if it boots
I have not tried changing the device to radeon or to vesa with the non-AMD specific version on install, but I wasn't sure that it would help
and after your window manager starts is the graphics ok?
yes
changing the xorg graphics driver does not affect the bootup screen.
I thought it might keep it from preforming so poorly after the desktop boots though
there is a discussion about those cards: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=2007697
I am not sure whether you need the nvidia drvires or ATI drivers.
thanks
